intro: Manganaroa paniculata var. paraguayensis, commonly known as the Paraguay mangrove, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its woody structure and ability to thrive in saline environments. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are often greenish or yellowish in color. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. This species plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for various marine and terrestrial organisms.
